website_summaries.verdict: A fun, 16-foot slip-and-slide for two riders that includes a pair of slide boogies.
pros: Not only does this unit allow two sliders to ride at once, but kids 5 to 12 get to travel beneath an arch of water that sprays up from the bumpers
The slide is easy to set up and includes 2 side anchors and 2 repair patches
cons: Depending on your water pressure and the slope of your yard, the sprinklers might not coat every area of the slide with water

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My kids like loooove it!!! Add a little dish detergent to make more slippery
customer_reviews.author: K. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a bunch of 25+girls weekend trip and it was the highlight of the trip! Worked great! I was worried because the reviews said it ripped and wasn't slippery enough, those reviews couldn't have been further from the truth. It was so much fun! Made us feel like we were little kids again!
customer_reviews.author: Justin & Heather

customer_reviews.title: Worked for party
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of negative reviews... the product i received worked perfectly for my child’s 1st birthday. About 5-6 kids, ages 4-12 slid on it for 2 hours straight with no issue..
customer_reviews.author: EmilyMoran

customer_reviews.title: Great fun !
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price! Seriously how can you beat it??? Was a huge hit at my daughters birthday party!!! Only drawback was the side opposite the water hardly got wet, easy fix though. We used a sprinkler for the other side , problem solved!
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For - This Things Sucks
customer_reviews.text: The instructions say to lay it on a flat grassy surface. That's untrue. You need a somewhat inclined surface for this to really work. It also says to wet the surface before having the kids slide to that they can glide across it. Water isn't nearly enough. You need to apply something to it to make it more slippery, like detergent. So, if you have a somewhat inclined surface that's smooth and grassy and you apply a little detergent then this can be fun. Otherwise, it's a waste of $20. I'm gonna donate ours to the local landfill. The kids hated it, and immediately went back to their blow up kiddie pool, which was a far better buy.
customer_reviews.author: L. Brightful

customer_reviews.title: Not Enough Water
customer_reviews.text: The water does not come out of the tube in significant enough amounts to actually wet the slide. Plenty of water accumulates at the bottom, but that is no help. We tried setting the slide up in different configurations in order to encourage the water to flow better, but no luck. Unhappy mom here.
customer_reviews.author: Petunia

customer_reviews.title: My 9 year old twins loved it...Be sure to get this double wide!!!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, durability...three kids, all 9 years old played on this thing for about three hours the other day. No damage. It withstood the test. That's good news! As I wrote in the headline, be absolutely sure to get the double wide as they extra width is critical to the fun element. Lastly, I don't think this will last for ever, it's not priced to, but I have to tell you, so far so good. It's folded up and ready to be put out for the 4th of July back yard fun.
customer_reviews.author: E Hemingway

customer_reviews.title: Water does not spray onto the slide
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this. The water does not spray on the slide. Some streams spray on the closest side but nothing on the far side. Most of it sprays on the ground instead of the slide. I ended up buying a sprinkler just so my kids could use it. With a sprinkler and a little dish soap it works good and the kids have a blast. I should not have had to buy something else to make it work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction, looked like it could have been fun
customer_reviews.text: Well, grandkids came in today, so the already knew I had the slip and slide. Set everything out, put a big tarp down under the slip and slide for several reasons mainly though to make sure it didn't sit directly on anything pokie and give them as landing zone if went past the end. So after reading instructions,I hooked up a hose. That's when problems arose. Directly above the hose connection the seam was split. I looked closer and it was like there had been no welding or gluing of that area of the seam. I had to tell the kids that it wasn't going to work.
customer_reviews.author: Gary G

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: I love this slip and slide! Soooo much fun! The water sprays over two feet high and it works great, very slippery! My niece and nephews are four, five, and thirteen, and they have a blast playing on it, I am 28 and I also have fun sliding!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Junk, don't waste your money. Probably the easiest thing to design and the manufacturer failed on so many parts. First, way too many holes leading to lack of pressure, holes are only on one side and don't spray to other side and most of the holes point away from the sliding surface. After duck taping at least 20 holes the slide works much better, just in time for my 35lb daughter to slide I to the end breaking a seam. Literally lasted less than 2 hours and that includes the time I spent plugging holes.
customer_reviews.author: Wyoman

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: in the picture the sprinkler pieces along the side look good but they are only on one side and because the water runs to the end you don't have any water pressure at the "top" where you first hit the slide therefore it's not wet. The plastic is thin and cheap and the "anchors" don't stay in the ground at all. You cannot use this on a hill because of the water situation. I'd have spent my money better buying an industrial tarp and running a sprinkler nearby.
customer_reviews.author: Casey Boehmer

customer_reviews.title: The kids had fun
customer_reviews.text: The kids really liked the slip and slide. The air cushions were a lot of fun and the kids loved those. Although it didn’t take long for one to spring a leak. I gave this product three starts because the sprinkler part is disappointing. It leaks where the hose hooks in so there was not enough pressure for the water to get to both sides of the slip and slide. We just put a regular sprinkler next to to the slip and slide and that worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Katie H.

customer_reviews.title: Only half gets wet
customer_reviews.text: Only the yellow half gets wet. Can’t race with only half working. Boards are pretty useless. Sending it back. Yellow side with no board works fine but defeats the purpose of it that way. Yes you can add an extra hose I guess but I don’t have another hose connector nearby. Dish soap stings eyes- that’s a terrible suggestion.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: One slide is good, the other side stays dry and useless.
customer_reviews.text: Slide sprayer only covers one side of slide. Perhaps with city water and a lot more water pressure it MIGHT get to the other side, but with my well set at 75 PSI, the water only hits one side of the slide, making the other side useless. no races, not possible to use. Because it is two slides wide, the pool at the bottom is big and makes a nice end to the slide, but a one at a time slide is not what we were buying.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton David Hague

customer_reviews.title: I'm big, and I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I am an adult 200# male. I am fit and work construction. During the Phoenix summers, the best feeling in the world is either dipping in a pool or rocking a slip n slide. The house I currently own does not have a pool so I got a slip n slide. The only complaint is that the 'slide' is not long enough and that I left it on my lawn for 5-6 hours without new water flow and the plastic burned my lawn. That's totally on me though.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Too Short and Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: At first, my only complaint was that this slip n slide is much shorter than our last one. My four year old was the only one who didn’t slide way off the end each time. It is much too short for my older kids (who are only 6, 8, and 10). Then on our 4th day of play (after only owning it for a couple weeks), it ripped in two places. The first rip started right between the blue and yellow “lanes,” and the second rip is where the lanes meet the pool at the end. This is poor design and poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Average
customer_reviews.text: The picture on box is a bit deceiving. The inflatable boogie boards are quite small. I am using them for a three-year-old and they are a good size but for older kids way too small. Even though this is a double lane the second lane does not stay spread out too well and just FYI be sure to note the water only sprays from the left side (nicer ones spray from both sides). Was expecting a bit more for the price but all in all it keeps my toddler happy on a hot day. My personal opinion is this is great for one kid but if you have more than one kid go for a triple lane.
customer_reviews.author: ALS

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last
customer_reviews.text: I had really high hopes for this. Previous reviews said poor quality. It lasted 3 uses and came apart at the seems. Had to throw it out. It’s super fun for the kids but don’t expect it to last too long.
customer_reviews.author: JHS

customer_reviews.title: fun for the kids
customer_reviews.text: this was purchased for a party, the kids had a blast racing each other. however the little boogie boards were not useful , they caused friction and would slide out of the kids hands, but it was a cool concept. the material foe the slip in slide was your normal vinyl it seemed well put together luckily it held together . i would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Krissy Noel

customer_reviews.title: Holes after one use
customer_reviews.text: We used the waterslide on our lawn. Prior to setting it up, I made sure there were no rocks, sticks, etc. After one use, the water slide had 2 holes. We patched them and after 3-4 uses more holes developed. I would not buy this waterslide again. I would buy a more expensive one that (hopefully) is better quality.
customer_reviews.author: K. Franks

customer_reviews.title: Ripped after second use
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my 9 year old son who weighs approx 58 lbs. he played on it twice and it’s already ripped. He used it as directed (I know little boys can be rough on things, but I supervised, so I know he didn’t use it in a way it wasn’t intended to be used). I can’t believe the lack of quality. Really disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Jennie Naylor

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money unless . . .
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money unless: 1. You have the water pressure of a fire hose 2. You use it with really small/young children (no older/bigger than about your average 4 year old) 3. Your yard is perfectly flat and slopes significantly downward Otherwise, don't waste your money; just let the kids run through a sprinkler and/or spray them with a hose yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Margo Seiple

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: This is our first time buying a slip and slide for kids during the summer months here in Arizona. We've only had it for one week and already there is a tear in the middle not sure how this happened but it's fixable definitely not happy with the value of the this thing. We took it out again after not using it for about 2 wks. Then the little pool area starts deflating and we have a huge puddle of water. Turns out the seal on the bottom tore. No waaay of sealing this tear at ALL! Have to return it. Was alright while it lasted. But I won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: PrisQuinceJesse

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a wish list for my 3 year old grandson's birthday. My family lives in Maine and I live in PA. I was so excited to be in Maine when his present arrived. My son-in-law set the slip-n-slide up, turned the water on and hardly a trickle of water was going over the slide. Tried different areas in the yard, nothing. Needless this was totally a big disappointment to my grandchildren and to me. I would not recommend this item .......look elsewhere for a fun gift.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Can not stand water pressure
customer_reviews.text: I liked the first time we used it. The second time the top blew out. So we patched it with clothes pins so the bottom could be used. After around the seventh time, it blew out around the hose connection.
customer_reviews.author: deb

customer_reviews.title: DIDN’T LAST AN HOUR👹
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my grandkids. They received it on 8/16/20. I was sent a picture at 3:32,of them playing on it. By 4:30,received another one,showing it tore...How is that possible!!??? How embarrassing!..
customer_reviews.author: Roberta

customer_reviews.title: Poor construction, got one use out of it.
customer_reviews.text: Well I was warned by previous reviews and they were right. These are nowhere near as tough as the ones we had when I was a kid. It only lasted for one use by small children before splitting open.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 4 yr old grandson visiting us. I knew that adults would try this and it wouldn’t hold up. The box clearly says this is for children not adults. It held up well, no tears. Used multiple days and a highlight of the visit.
customer_reviews.author: JBA

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work as intended.
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the $25 price. Bought a single one on clearance for $7 a year ago, and that one works way better. The boogie board things don’t work for sliding, and the squirters do not reach the second lane even with the water pressure on full blast. So it’s really just a single-lane slip n slide with useless floaties.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work on natural grass lawn.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return as doesn’t work at all on even the tiniest bumpy natural grass lawn. We have huge side yard next to our pool and thought it would be such fun but alas unslidable on slightly uneven grass. Kids have done before and were so disappointed but it had been put up on fake Astro turf lawn
customer_reviews.author: Shoily

customer_reviews.title: but the kids like it nonetheless
customer_reviews.text: Very popular with the kids at a bbq. Spent hours on it. The water doesn't go very high on the sides, but the kids like it nonetheless. It's a pain to clean/fold up, and I'm not sure it will be in great condition next time we want to use it. But for the price, it did the job nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Delacruz

customer_reviews.title: Does not work!
customer_reviews.text: I would give zero stars if I could. It was a waste! My kids could not slide on it and we followed directions. All my kids could do is splash themselves with the water. The would have had more fun with just our garden hose.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Slip n' Slide
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this last summer when our grandchildren came to visit us from Georgia. Their local cousins joined in on the fun. Many hours of entertainment. Easy to set up and take down.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Godbold

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this
customer_reviews.text: Wham-o, What a disappointment I gave it a one star rating simply because I couldn't give a zero. The anchors were missing, no big deal , easy enough to come up with something to stake it down. This slip n slide is a total waste of money. Couldn't get enough water pressure to get both "lanes " wet. I set up a sprinkler beside it & that worked just fine, but a simple strip of plastic would do the same. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: DGKAB

customer_reviews.title: Good for One time use only
customer_reviews.text: I found this to be made pretty cheaply. Had a family party with 10 little kids, the oldest being 8 and by the end of the day it wasn't worth saving. These children were not rough, just product made very cheaply
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Gasparotto

customer_reviews.title: Popped first day of use
customer_reviews.text: I like that their are 2 lanes and the built in sprinkler feature. Howwever, the black part at the bottom where the mini pool collects, popped within an hour of us setting it up.
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: Best thing since gum!
customer_reviews.text: This was hilariously nostalgic and so much fun. Honestly the most fun I've had in years! Dont know what the kids thought but who cares lol this was totally for the adults
customer_reviews.author: jessica james

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality!
customer_reviews.text: This slip n' slide was used exactly 7 times before the lining tore. My nephews and nieces were disappointed that the fun didn't last long.
customer_reviews.author: Marcie Poe

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product just took it out of the Box brand new set it at turned on water there was a big huge hole in the seam and the water will not go through it correctly also says it comes with 2 patch kit It does not have one patch kit at all in it Would not recommend this to anyone made very cheaply and does not come with what it says it does
customer_reviews.author: Debby

customer_reviews.title: Durable, thick and fun summer water game
customer_reviews.text: My grandson and his friends loved this and played all day. Wish it was a little longer. Six kids all day. Very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Tamera Williams

customer_reviews.title: Dry second slide, half filled splash pool, spray ends up on lawn instead of slide
customer_reviews.text: This product has a great concept, unfourtanitly a poor design. The water spraying along the edge does not meet the 2nd slide so it is dry. My poor niece actually got a bit of a burn on her leg from trying to slide on the dry plastic. The rest of the water sprays on the 1st slide and onto the grass. The pool at the end of the slide only half fills. Most of the water drains out the side. I will be contacting them for return and refund, I will keep you updated on how that goes.
customer_reviews.author: SAM

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with slide boogies.
customer_reviews.text: This product shows it comes with 2 slide boogies. It did not. That's why I spent the extra money for this one. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: psk

customer_reviews.title: Received used item
customer_reviews.text: Received item today. Was a little disappointed it appeared we had received a used item, the box was open and one of the little rafts was damaged and would not inflate. I thought I was purchasing new, confused as to why I received an open and apparently used and damaged item.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t spray properly. Bummed.
customer_reviews.text: We have very good water pressure coming out of our hose but this slip n slide will not function well. It doesn’t spray water on to the slide itself so we need another hose to run water down the slide. Waste of money and kids disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: KtCalil

customer_reviews.title: Sent me used box and does not work
customer_reviews.text: First of all they gave me used box. Very disappointed with it there are lot of issues with it 1. does not skid 2. water does not come on slide where as it sprinkles all over the place. 3. it needs more than 2 anchors .. they should have placed 6 anchors
customer_reviews.author: sandeep Akhare

customer_reviews.title: Fun Fun Good Time
customer_reviews.text: One of the most fun things we've ever had for our grandkids to play with (ages 5,6,7). They played a long time on the slip N Slide and only quit when it was time for dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra R Rigby

customer_reviews.title: Took five minutes to rip.
customer_reviews.text: I racked our yard and the boys were not being crazy. Ripped down the middle in five tries by the boys. What happened to those yellow ones that last year after year for $10.
customer_reviews.author: workingmom

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: We have good water pressure but the "spray" only went up 8 inches or so on 70% of the length. It did not reach the blue "racing" side. Pretty close to deceptive advertising.
customer_reviews.author: G. Michael

customer_reviews.title: Fun summer toy
customer_reviews.text: Just like from our childhoods, the slip n slide does not disappoint in keeping kids happy on a summer day!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Decent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Item is well packaged and a bit sturdier than other brands. The sliding surface isn't quite a long as other, similar products (15' vs 16-18'). Can be patched with included repair "kit" or duct tape. Took four days to arrive, rather than two (via Prime).
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Ok product
customer_reviews.text: Water only comes from one side and sides do curl so is difficult to cover mat with water. It was ok. I'm not familiar with other products, so I'm not sure about the quality vs the price.
customer_reviews.author: MollyM

customer_reviews.title: Needs turf to stake down
customer_reviews.text: Needs turf to stake down slide. Unfortunately, we have artificial turf so we're unable to hold down the slide. Actual water flow through hose impacts actual sprinkler spread.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: We had this about 2 weeks and a giant rip happened along the black part where the water comes out. Attempted to repair but didn’t work. Super disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: water fun
customer_reviews.text: Used at church for a fall fest the adults and kids loved it . only thing is we went one at a time because the water didn't cove both lanes so we went down the middle and had a tarp under it and used with out the boards
customer_reviews.author: Deb Attema

customer_reviews.title: Fine
customer_reviews.text: Works good but I wish it had water on both sides.
customer_reviews.author: Robin CRITTENDEN

customer_reviews.title: Don't be fooled
customer_reviews.text: Looks good in the picture. In real life the water pressure was not good enough to make it on both sides. We never made it to the end of the wet lane.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.ABs

customer_reviews.title: Fun but...
customer_reviews.text: Fun but it broke within a few days right where the hose connects, making it impossible to patch. Seams to be a trend with slip and slides :0/
customer_reviews.author: jessie

customer_reviews.title: Total JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: Total piece of crap. There is nearly a sprinkle coming from the holes. The item is poorly designed and creates a krink in the water flow before the end section. Don’t waste your money. This was made to poison the Earth with more plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Was not a fun product. Was not slippery. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: MontanaWes

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed yet again. Maybe i don't have enough water pressure...but my kids really can't even slide on this thing, and the lovely arches of water are a joke...it just piddles out.
customer_reviews.author: wonders

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: Got it for our son’s birthday party. Set it up and the water only sprayed down one side instead of both.
customer_reviews.author: Lacie Marie

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Kids loved it. Normally I wouldn’t spend money on this but my kids really wanted one. They really liked it.
customer_reviews.author: kelsiemac

customer_reviews.title: waste of $19.99
customer_reviews.text: Do not purchase. Within an hour of use the ring around the bottom pool had a hole in it that was past repairable. One of our boogie boards arrived with a hole in it and then the patch wouldn't keep it covered. I literally feel like I threw away $20 in a hour.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Party Favorite!
customer_reviews.text: This really took the party to a new level. We purchased the Wave Rider for my granddaughters’s 11th birthday party and the kids had a blast! There were no issues with the product. We’ll see how it holds up for the next party as we are going to store it for several weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up
customer_reviews.text: So easy to set up all you have to do is attach hose and blow up the surf boards
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Ebbitt

customer_reviews.title: Meh..
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps we don't have the right yard for this but we weren't really sliding. We have a flat yard. The water that sprinkles out of the slip and slide were pretty good in height but you definitely need a slope/ hill for this to work. Seemed a little short too.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaiian Tweety

customer_reviews.title: Water comes out from 1 side only
customer_reviews.text: Too narrow for 2 people. Water only comes out on the yellow sidebar black round part. Blue gets dry quickly. Only 2 pins to hold it in place. So... so....
customer_reviews.author: Zeki

customer_reviews.title: Cautionary Tale
customer_reviews.text: Have had a couple of these "slip n' slide" things and their just "OK". Not really wide enough to allow for out of control kids to stay centered. Not enough water coming out of the holes on the sides to keep the slide slippery enough. And quite frankly an afternoon of slip and slide fun will kill your grass where you set it up..
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: poorly manufactured
customer_reviews.text: there is supposed to be a seam that runs the length of the product to contain the water, the first one was damaged, the 2nd one "replacement" is just as bad. Appears to be manufacturing defect as 50%+ of the water just flows out the base.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Peoples

customer_reviews.title: Will NOT Function as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Input valve leaked immediately. Water tubes will NOT remain in place in order to shower the slide...Had to constantly adjust tubes.. after every slide. Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.author: GCP

customer_reviews.title: Great fun for all the kids - even the ones over 40
customer_reviews.text: Our two and four year old granddaughters have had more hours of fun with the Slip Slide than any other toy they have! Easy to set up and hours of laughs! Should have gotten it soonet.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: This is JUNK. SAVE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.text: This was a TERRIBLE purchase. If I hadn’t thrown away the box- I would have returned this junk of a product. I cannot believe I spent 40.00 on this for our family day for my nieces and nephews — save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great summer fun!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 grandchildren ages 3 to 12 used this many days this summer. It really held up well. I think one season is about all you can expect with this much use but I feel like I certainly got my money’s worth and will order again when this one wears out! They all really had fun with it!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Leaks just below where the hose attaches so water doesn’t actual spray like a fountain, it just kind drizzles out near the pool area. Have to use a second hose to actually wet the slide. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: My 9yr old & 5yr old were not excited to use this slip & slide. Wasn’t slippery even with soap. Ok for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For younger Children
customer_reviews.text: It was less than I expected for the price. Side water holes wouldnt stay upright,an not very wide or long. Exception, great for toddler size.
customer_reviews.author: Crissylyn

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The kids loved it at my son’s 6th birthday party. Really cool.
customer_reviews.author: Tanisha

customer_reviews.title: Always a hit with the kids
customer_reviews.text: The best gift for kids during this time and for the summer heat!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grandkids had a great time. We placed it on a hill in ...
customer_reviews.text: Grandkids had a great time. We placed it on a hill in our yard and added dish soap which made them slide much better. Water doesn't come out of the holes quite like the picture, but works well enough for them to enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Chiles

customer_reviews.title: Lasted all summer!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome and lasted all summer. Not sure what everyone else is complaining about.... just pick it up and dry it out every night and only leave it out when you’re using it. That worked for us.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Sather

customer_reviews.title: Fun decent quality
customer_reviews.text: We had fun worked fine for us. Put dish soap or baby oil on the slide mat to make you slide faster with ease.
customer_reviews.author: GSXR JADE

customer_reviews.title: Ripped on second use.
customer_reviews.text: I buy one of these for my kids every summer. Usually we get about 6 good weeks of play out of it before we throw it away. I know this isn't something that should last year after year but this one ripped the second time they used it!! I taped it back together and it was okay for another day but then today it ripped again where the water runs through and is now useless. It didn't even last a week such a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Jason M Allen

customer_reviews.title: Okay item
customer_reviews.text: It keeps switching out, constantly need to redirect the water flow. Kids have fun but not for that long.
customer_reviews.author: patricia jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this item.
customer_reviews.text: Need a ‘no star’ category except it did come when promised. This was used one time. Six children. Supervised play, so no roughhousing. Tore all down the side. I recommend you save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Foley

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money for me
customer_reviews.text: Used 2 times and it busted open. Waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky girl

customer_reviews.title: Thoroughly Disappointed - Don't buy this product
customer_reviews.text: The material was very thin and cheap. The product was torn and appeared to have tried to patch it. The price should have been $10.00. Very disappointed. I cannot believe Amazon sells this product for the vendor.
customer_reviews.author: Ms.G

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Worse design! The water only is on one side and then end ......so the second side had no water on it! The stakes do not keep it intact......especially the side with no water! It provides 2 float type things to slide on...... stopped keeping air after the first use!
customer_reviews.author: Jerry M.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Immediately got a hole in it. Had to throw it away before the kids ever got to use it. I tried the repair kit and a new hole popped up every time I patched one over.
customer_reviews.author: JamesW

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, but it doesn't come with stakes for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, but it doesn't come with stakes for the ground and there's only one side that sprays water. It was an epic failure and I had 8 kids excited to use this for a birthday party.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: One time use
customer_reviews.text: We opened this directly from the box and immediately noticed and it had a 5in by 3in tear in the plastic. I gave this product some stars because my 6 yr old did enjoy playing with it. It’s definitely a one time/event backyard toy. I find it so strange that only one lane has the water sprayer leaving the other drier and harder to use. It’s really only one lane.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Christine Finley

customer_reviews.title: Your better off going to Walmart and picking up a cheap ...
customer_reviews.text: Big hole in the tube at the bottom of the pool after 1 days use. Kids were just sliding on it nothing crazy. Now we have to put the sprinkler on it. Seriously piece of junk. Your better off going to Walmart and picking up a cheap one. At least those last a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Bunneyclouse

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the kids birthday party. Everybody arrived, we go to set it up and it’s missing pieces and the hose part was cracked. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Aliciav

customer_reviews.title: Not what you order
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely not the product we ordered and paid for! We ordered the slip n slide with the boogie boards but this did not come with any, it does not stay in the ground with the anchors that are provided, the sprayers go to the left as opposed to the right where the sliders slide, definitely would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: amber a meagher

customer_reviews.title: A great gift for grandkids.
customer_reviews.text: This one replaces the worn out original Slip & Slide my children used growing up. A fun activity!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Burkett

customer_reviews.title: Fun slip n slide
customer_reviews.text: Nephews loved it! Everything was fine no holes air anything.
customer_reviews.author: Pink

customer_reviews.title: NOT WHAT I ORDERED!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughters birthday party. Says it comes with two ‘bonus boogies’- they were not included- box sent was not the same shown. Feel like this was a ‘bait & switch’
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer G

customer_reviews.title: It would make a better lawn sprinkler.
customer_reviews.text: The spray goes off the side of the slide so you end up watering the grass more than the slide.
customer_reviews.author: Riley Mom

customer_reviews.title: Every moms dream!
customer_reviews.text: I have 4 kids ages 4-11. They were able to set it up all on their own and they played for hours!
customer_reviews.author: Trisha Morra

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: It actually works! We have ok water pressure and this one actually sprayed like it was supposed to! Holding up well after several uses by multiple crazy boys.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

product_meta.title: Wham-O Slip N Slide Wave Rider Double with 2 Slide Boogies
product_meta.description:
Wham-O Slip 'N Slide Double Wave Rider. the Original Backyard water slide. For ages 5 to 12. With 2 bonus Slide Boogies Included.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Wham-O Slip 'N Slide Double Wave Rider. the Original Backyard water slide. For ages 5 to 12. 15 foot slide area. With 2 bonus Slide Boogies Included.
